question: Question 5-08/30/2012 Which ONE of the following is the most correct reason for having an installed neutron source  within the core? An installed neutron source is very important during startup because without of a neutron  source...

question: Question 6-08/30/2012 Two critical reactors at low power are identical, except that Reactor 1 has a beta fraction of  0.0065 and Reactor 2 has a beta fraction of 0.0072. answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Equation Sheet. τ = (L*/ρ) + [(β-ρ)/λ_effρ]

answers.answer: b. The final power in the Reactor 1 will be lower than the final power in the Reactor 2
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Equation Sheet. τ = (L*/ρ) + [(β-ρ)/λ_effρ]

answers.answer: c. The trace (power vs. time) of the Reactor 1 will be higher than the trace of the Reactor 2
answers.feedback: Correct.

question: Question 9-08/30/2012 Which ONE of the following is the MAIN reason for operating with thermal neutrons instead of  fast neutrons?

answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction of Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1982, Figure 2.6, page 2-39

answers.answer: b. Moderator temperature coefficient becomes positive as neutron energy increases.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction of Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1982, Figure 2.6, page 2-39

answers.answer: c. Neutron absorption in non fuel material increases exponentially as neutron energy  increases.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction of Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1982, Figure 2.6, page 2-39

answers.answer: d. The average number of delayed neutrons produced per fission is higher than the average number of prompt neutrons
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction of Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1982, Section 3.3.7, page 3-37
